title: NASA Awards Agencywide Digital, Information Technology Contract
summary: NASA has selected Rothe Ares Joint Venture of San Antonio to manage digital communication services, as well as information technology services, for all agency centers and headquarters.

title: Keeping watch on aggressor satellites a key challenge for U.S. Space Force
summary: The U.S. Space Force is facing a new challenge in its role to safeguard the country's satellites from foreign threats, as Russian and Chinese satellites engage in disruptive maneuvers and follow other nations' spacecraft in orbit.

title: Lockheed Martin declares success demonstrating tech for in-orbit satellite servicing
summary: The Linuss experiment — short for Lockheed Martin’s In-space Upgrade Satellite System — went to orbit on the USSF-44 national security mission launched by a SpaceX Falcon Heavy.

title: NASA Sets Coverage of Spacewalk, News Conference for Station Upgrades
summary: Two crew members, including a NASA astronaut, living aboard the International Space Station will conduct a spacewalk Friday, April 28, to continue installation of hardware to support future power system upgrades.

title: Options for achieving Tactically Responsive Space
summary: The U.S. Space Force is considering a variety of ways to rapidly respond to changing threats. One option is storing a satellite like Victus Nox, the satellite Millennium Space Systems […]

title: Crunchtime ahead for Victus Nox
summary: The U.S. Space Force is conducting an important test of its ability to rapidly respond to world events.

title: SpaceX scrubs first Starship launch attempt
summary: SpaceX called off the first attempt to launch its integrated Starship vehicle from Texas April 17 because of a valve problem.

title: On National Security | Satellite imaging industry responds to demand for intelligence fusion
summary: The war in Ukraine has shown the power of commercial satellites to deliver crucial intelligence to the world. The satellite imagery industry is trying to build on that momentum and […]

title: SpaceX scrubs first launch attempt of its Starship launch system [Updated]
summary: No human alive has ever seen a rocket this powerful take flight.

title: Orbit Fab raises $28.5 million
summary: Orbit Fab, a startup developing in-space satellite refueling services, has raised $28.5 million to accelerate work on its first missions.
